description:
Encapsulates the metadata about a control task (also named control method) of a type in the XL Deploy type system. Control tasks allow actions to be executed on CIs and can be invoked from the GUI or the CLI. Control tasks specify a list of steps to be executed in order. Control tasks can be parametrized in two ways:
  1. by specifying arguments to the control task in the control task configuration
  2. by allowing the user to specify parameters to the control task during control task execution
Arguments are configured in the control task definition in the synthetic.xml file. Arguments are specified as attributes on the synthetic method definition XML and are passed as-is to the control task. Parameters are specified by defining a parameters CI type, which needs to extend the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Parameters} CI.

description:
A creator is a method that can be invoked when a ConfigurationItem is created. For instance, create other CIs based on an artifact.

A @Creator method should adhere to the following rule:

  • it must be static
  • take a {@code CreatorContext}. The CreatorContext provides methods to create, update or delete CIs.
  • Optional: A Map of attributes

description:
Base interface of all configuration item types.
 <p/>
 Do not directly implement this class, instead extend {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.base.BaseConfigurationItem} or one of the types
 derived from it (e.g. {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.base.BaseDeployable}, {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.base.BaseDeployed}
 or {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.base.BaseContainer}).
 <p/>
 The following contract is required: - The Type of a ConfigurationItem should be stored in a field called 'type'.

name: com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.ControlTask
description:
A control task is a method that can be invoked on a ConfigurationItem, to perform some action. For instance, that starting or stopping of a Container.

A @ControlTask method should adhere to the following rules:

  • take either no parameters or a {@code Map}.
  • return a {@code List}

 during the deployment and the host created will be provisioned by this provisioner.

description: A {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version} of an {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Application} which can contain a list of other {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version}s, as well as artifacts and resource specifications (a collection of {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Deployable}s) that can be deployed onto a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Container}. Please note that the word package can be used to refer to a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version}. In this case the definition makes more sense, as a CompositePackage can contain a list of other packages.

description:
Containers are configuration items (CIs) that {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Deployable} CIs can be deployed to. The result of the deployment
 is represented as a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Deployed}.

 Containers are grouped together in an {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Environment}. Examples of containers are a host, WebSphere server
 or WebLogic cluster.

methods.name: getFileEncodings
methods.description:
This will return a map that specifies which files map to which encodings.

 By default XL Deploy will use UTF-8 for replacing placeholders in files, unless this property contains a regex as key which matches the path of the file within the artifact.
 If a key matches, XL Deploy will use the attached value in the map as encoding for replacing placeholders in the file.
methods.returnDescription: map that maps a regex to a target encoding for a file.

description:
Conceptually, an Application is a configuration item (CI) representing a real-world application, that can be deployed on a specific middleware.

Technically, an Application is a group of all the associated {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Version}s. A Version (sometimes also called package) can be either a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeploymentPackage} or a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.CompositePackage}, and contains a collection of {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeployableArtifact}s and resource specifications. Such a package can be deployed on a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Container}.

description:
Deployables are {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.ConfigurationItem}s (CIs) that can be deployed to a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Container}.

 There are two types of Deployables: {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeployableArtifact}s and resource specifications, which is a generic name
 for any Deployable CI that is not a DeployableArtifact, for example a datasource, a queue, or a connection factory.

 Deployables are part of a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeploymentPackage} or of a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.CompositePackage}.

description:
Deployeds are configuration items (CIs) that represent {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Deployable}s CIs in their deployed form on the target {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Container}. Deployeds go through the following life-cycle:
  • The deployed is created on a target container for the first time in an initial deployment.
  • The deployed is upgraded to a new version in an upgrade deployment.
  • The deployed is removed from the target container when it is undeployed.

name: com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.CandidateValuesFilter
description:
A CandidateValuesFilter can augment the {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.services.SearchParameters} for a ConfigurationItem search.

A @CandidateValuesFilter method should adhere to the following rules:

  • The method should be static
  • The method should take 2 parameters:
    1. The {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.ConfigurationItem} that is the context
    2. The {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.reflect.PropertyDescriptor} that the filter should be based on.
  • The method should return a new {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.services.SearchParameters}

description:
A Version of an {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.Application}, which can be represented either as a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.DeploymentPackage} or as a {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.CompositePackage}.

A Version is sometimes also called package, in the sense that it groups together a collection of artifacts and resource specifications of a specific version into a package. This is true especially when considering {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.udm.CompositePackage}s as containing a list of other packages.

name: com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.services.SearchParameters

methods.name: setType
methods.description: The desired type of the CI.

methods.name: addProperty
methods.description:
Search for the value of a property. This may be a property of type String or Enum.
 A {@link com.xebialabs.deployit.plugin.api.services.SearchParameters#type} is required to be able to use this filter.

methods.name: setParent
methods.description: The desired parent of the CI.

methods.name: setAncestor
methods.description: The desired ancestor of the CI.

methods.name: setName
methods.description:
A search pattern for the name. This is like the SQL "LIKE" pattern: the character '%' represents any string of
 zero or more characters, and the character '_' (underscore) represents any single character.

methods.name: setId
methods.description:
A search pattern for the id. This is like the SQL "LIKE" pattern: the character '%' represents any string of
 zero or more characters, and the character '_' (underscore) represents any single character.

methods.name: setBefore
methods.description: Sets the search parameters to search for CIs modified before the given date.

methods.name: setAfter
methods.description: Sets the search parameters to search for CIs modified after the given date.

methods.name: setPage
methods.description: Sets the page to be retrieved.

methods.name: setResultsPerPage
methods.description: Sets the number of results to be retrieved per page.

methods.name: setDepth
methods.description: Set the depth of the search. By default it searches the full depth of the tree.

methods.name: setExactNameSearch
methods.description: Set to true for exact name search, default is false.

methods.name: setExactIdSearch
methods.description: Set to true for exact id search, default is false.

methods.name: getBefore
methods.returnDescription: The specified date for CIs modified before this date.

methods.name: getAfter
methods.returnDescription: The specified date for CIs modified after this date.

methods.name: getResultsPerPage
methods.returnDescription: The number of results retrieved per page.

methods.name: getDepth
methods.returnDescription: The depth of the search. Default is full depth.

description: Declarative query parameters for searching the JCR repository for Configuration Items.
